title: The Brooklyn Mom Having an Affair Because Her Husband Had One First
text:
New York’s Sex Diaries series asks anonymous city dwellers to record a week in their sex lives — with comic, tragic, often sexy, and always revealing results. Photo: James Gallagher

This week, a woman having an affair at work to try to heal her marriage: 36, married, straight, Brooklyn.

DAY ONE

7:10 a.m. Our 3-year-old comes into our room and gets into bed with me and my husband. I almost always get up with him and let my husband sleep. We have breakfast and watch a kid show.

9:00 a.m. I drop off our little guy at preschool. I put my earphones on to listen to my favorite podcast — Where Shall We Begin with Esther Perel — and get on the train.

12:00 p.m. I’m an administrator at a university. Sometimes it’s very busy and sometimes it’s very slow. When it’s slow, I’m always tempted to email a professor who works here too. He and I have had an on-and-off affair for over a year. I justify it because my husband had an affair when I was pregnant and when we had a newborn, but I still feel kind of weird about it. I email the professor just for the rush and to keep my day interesting.

4:00 p.m. No word back from prof. Typical!

5:30 p.m. I meet my husband and son at home. We play a board game and make dinner. My husband is still extremely hot to me; he’s getting better looking as he gets older. We have a nice night together.

9:30 p.m. I go to bed very early because I need an insane amount of sleep. I read some Sally Rooney and drift off.

DAY TWO

7:00 a.m. Still half-asleep, I check my email and see the professor has written back. Making plans is always hard with him. He’s in a sexless marriage and his wife strikes me as a lesbian. He’s very hard to read but we have a certain closeness, even if the sex isn’t the best. I hope we can hang out soon.

11:00 a.m. Plans with professor are moving forward. Seems like we will meet Thursday for drinks after work. We both know what this means, even though we would never say it out loud.

2:00 p.m. Texting pick-up and dinner logistics with my husband. We are a well-oiled machine and very good at making our lives run smoothly. It makes me feel guilty I’m meeting another guy, but I justify it with “he did it first.”

I suspected my husband was cheating for a long time. She was over at our house (and would hold our baby!). They hung out a lot; she was a very sexual person and they seemed to be in constant contact. I’m not a snooper but I finally saw a suspicious text. After I looked at a few, it was clear. I confronted him and he admitted it immediately. He had been dying to end it and I think he was ultimately relieved I found out. It was making him anxious and crazy and she was very high-maintenance and manipulative and was always starting fights. She was also married and we went to their wedding (her third marriage by 30) together during the affair! The whole thing was insane.

It’s not even the fact that he had an affair that I have an issue with, it’s that he did it when I was vulnerable and needed him most — through pregnancy and having a baby. I felt so alone and didn’t realize what was going on until I finally saw the texts. They worked together and she made both our lives hell for a couple years after that. I think he broke her heart, honestly. It truly devastated me and changed me as a person, and it’s still a sore subject. I guess I feel like it gives me a free pass to do whatever I want for now.

7:00 p.m. Dinner at home. We make a tofu stir-fry and hear about our son’s day. He makes us laugh a lot.

DAY THREE

11:00 a.m. I have drinks with the professor tomorrow and I’m thinking about my outfit. I want to look casual but sexy. My husband definitely has no idea about any of this. He really trusts me and I’m very good at hiding it. I think he would actually be fine with it because he still feels so badly about what he did, which was undeniably worse. I plan to tell him once it’s officially over with the professor.

3:00 p.m. Work is slow again so I stalk my husband’s old mistress online. She is gross and I hate her still. We blocked each other so I have to use Safari to see her pics. Work being slow is truly dangerous for me!

5:30 p.m. My husband picked up my son so I’m home alone. I’m all riled up about my date tomorrow and use the vibrator my husband got me to make myself come. This was the best gift ever. It takes about 45 seconds.

8:00 p.m. After bedtime, my husband heads out for a night with his friends. We give each other a lot of freedom, but sometimes I think that’s what gets us in trouble. We barely ask about each other’s night except to say if it was fun or not, and maybe mention what we ate. We are almost too similar.

2:15 a.m. My husband comes home quite drunk and falls asleep quickly next to me. Part of me wonders if he was really with “friends” but also, does it matter? I snuggle up against him and fall back asleep. I love this guy, I can’t help it.

DAY FOUR

7:15 a.m. It’s professor day! Makes me feel young again. I go with tight jeans and an Everlane top. Casual, but hopefully a little hot.

8:15 a.m. My husband stumbles out of bed. He said he had fun last night and then tells me about his friend’s dating drama so I guess he was with the guys? Whatever.

5:30 p.m. We meet in a neighborhood far away from work, where we won’t run into anyone. We go to a gross dark dive bar, as always. I get there first. When he gets there he puts down his credit card and keeps it open.

7:00 p.m. We are getting drunk, talking about our lives, and it’s so much fun. We decide to move to another bar.

7:30 p.m. He puts his hand on my leg mid-drink. This is what I live for: The moment when you realize someone wants you too and that person isn’t your husband — it’s my drug of choice. I don’t know if I’ll ever be able to not want this on some level.

8:30 p.m. We are fully drunk and making out in a booth at the bar. Even though this guy isn’t super cool or even hot, there is something about him that I like. Part of it is that no one would ever think this was going on between us. We’re very different. He’s a very by-the-book guy, child-free, successful, older, kind of boring. I’m younger and a free spirit, a hip Brooklyn mom to a T. But there’s just something between us.

9:30 p.m. I go to the bar bathroom and he follows me in a few minutes later. This is our signature move. We’ve never hooked up in a house, except once when my husband was away. We go kind of wild in the bathroom. If I really think about it, he doesn’t turn me on. I’ve never come with the professor. For me, this is about excitement, control, and empowerment after being cheated on at my lowest point. To anyone who has been hurt badly by a long-term cheating situation, I would recommend — cheat too! It really makes you feel better and it evens the field.

10:15 p.m. He comes and we go to Vaselka.

11:00 p.m. Professor gets me a Lyft and says to email him when I get home. We deleted each other’s numbers so we can’t text — too dangerous and intimate for us.

11:45 p.m. At home, I look in the mirror while I’m brushing my teeth and I’m like, WTF am I doing. I get into bed with my husband, who is asleep, but I can’t sleep. I’m really confused sometimes how this ended up being my life. Ultimately, it would not have been my first choice.

DAY FIVE

6:15 a.m. I’m up first, having barely slept. I snuggle up to my husband until he is half-awake and then I initiate sex. I can’t explain how much he still turns me on, and within minutes, I come. The professor could learn a thing or two from this guy.

7:00 a.m. My husband asks how my night was. I say it was good, just a happy hour with work people (sort of true?). I feel guilty, but ultimately my husband has my heart and this is just temporary and part of our recovery, even if he’s not aware of it.

8:00 a.m. I get an email back from the professor that is like two words (“Fun times”). It’s cold and makes me feel bad. Maybe this guy just sucks?

9:00 a.m. I work from home on Fridays so I drop off my little guy and go to the gym. I’m tired and hungover but feel like I need to do something “good.”

6:00 p.m We go out for an early burger dinner with our friends. I think about how much even our best friends don’t know about us. They would be shocked if they knew what I did last night. Having the secret is fun for me but also stressful.

8:00 p.m. Husband goes out after bedtime again. I can’t remember where he said he was going, I think some art show or something. I’m happy to be alone with my thoughts. I’m so tired and I fall asleep insanely early.

DAY SIX

7:10 a.m. It’s the weekend. I let my son watch a whole movie while I go back to bed.

4:00 p.m. We go to one of our favorite friends’ house in Bed Stuy for a playdate, drinks, weed pen, and dinner. Everyone has fun, we all get along great and laugh a lot. I love this town!

8:00 p.m. Go home. Do bedtime and watch the Aziz Ansari comedy special with my husband. We go to sleep early and I get this rush of feeling lucky.

DAY SEVEN

10:00 a.m. We make breakfast and clean the house. Take turns parenting because neither of us are really in the mood.

4:00 p.m. We go to an early dinner at my husband’s parents’ house with his brother and their kids. I always get nervous going over for dinner because they live near the professor, but it’s never been a problem.

7:15 p.m. We still haven’t even started dinner. The adults are fully drunk, the kids are being wild and running around.

8:00 p.m. We eat and my son starts to lose it because he’s exhausted. We give him ice cream to hold him over while we say our goodbyes and try to leave ASAP before he has a full tantrum.

8:20 p.m. The train is taking forever, and our son is fully and loudly crying on the platform as everyone stares at us in horror. Oh, Lord.

9:15 p.m. Finally home. So tired. Do bedtime and then go to bed. I kiss my husband and tell him I had a great weekend.

description: This week’s sex diary: a happily married woman deals with questions of infidelity: 36, married, straight, Cobble Hill.
